title.rendered: 23 million dollars in 10 minutes with NFTs

content.rendered:
Last Thursday the latest sales edition of the crypto artist Xcopy took place. It can be said that it was a complete success, since the NFTs Max Pain collection, made up of 7,394 copies, was sold in just 10 minutes.

The Max Pain Edition

In this edition Xcopy created non-fungible tokens with images of skulls with animated tones, vibrant colors and glitchy effects.

Each drawing was sold for the price of $3,108equivalent to the value of 1 Ether at the time of sale, raising an amount close to 23 million dollars in a space of only 10 minutes.

Who is XCOPY?

This is not the first successful collection of the artist, in December of last year a work entitled «Right Click and Save As Guy«, which translated into Spanish means, «Make a click with the right button and save as a boy», is sold for nearly $7.1 million. This artwork was created as a mockery for people who don’t value artworks on NFT. And it became a viral meme used sarcastically by fans and investors of crypto art.

Another work that gained prominence together with «Right Click and Save As Guy” It was All-Time High in The City. Both are on Decrypt’s list of the 15 most expensive NFTs on the SuperRare NFT auction and sales platform.

A peculiar feature of Xcopy is that it does not usually launch open editions. Its editions always have an exact number of pieces and a certain period of sale.

Xcopy is one of the most successful NFT artist of today. The proof of its great success is the trading volume that already generated a total of 25 billion dollars in 2021.

Non-Fungible Tokens are truly a new art revolution. This new technology allows to have works that cannot be plagiarized. We have no doubt that we are living in a historical moment of a new era of the artistic universe.
